title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots seek seventh Super Bowl title to surpass Steelers for most wins in NFL history.
Drake Maye could join rare group of second-year quarterbacks with Super Bowl win.
Coach Mike Vrabel aims to be first to win Super Bowl with Patriots as both player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims for a Super Bowl win with the Patriots to boost his Hall of Fame chances.
Diggs has 11,504 receiving yards, placing him 38th all-time, with potential to reach the top 15.
Diggs's Hall of Fame potential is uncertain despite notable career achievements, lacking major awards like Offensive Player of the Year.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame's class of 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with the Patriots, including key kicks in Super Bowl XXXVI and Super Bowl XXXVIII.
Vinatieri holds NFL records for points scored (2,673) and consecutive field goals made (44) during his 24-season career.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel simulates long Super Bowl halftime during final practice, a tactic used by Bill Belichick.
Key players including quarterback Drake Maye fully participated in practice; Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane limited due to injuries.
Rap artist Bad Bunny set for Super Bowl halftime show, with speculation of Cardi B joining as a guest performer.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: The Super Bowl LX will feature quarterbacks Drake Maye of the Patriots and Sam Darnold of the Seahawks.
New England's Milton Williams is expected to be a key defensive player against Seattle's offense in the matchup.
Wide receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba will be a critical offensive threat for Seattle with his impressive season performance.

title: Mass. company pleads guilty to OSHA violation that led to employee’s death
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: John Oliveira & Sons Stamp Concrete, Inc. pleaded guilty to OSHA violations in the 2023 death of worker Josué Tiquiram.
The company failed to use safety devices on heavy machinery that killed Tiquiram at an East Freetown site.
The company may face five years probation, a $500,000 fine, and restitution; sentencing is on May 4.

title: Here’s what Healey put up in her Super Bowl bet with Washington state governor
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey bet Washington Gov. Bob Ferguson Legal Sea Foods and Dunkin' products for Super Bowl LX.
Healey plans to attend Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara as part of a work trip to promote Massachusetts and support other Democratic governors.
Gov. Healey declared this weekend New England Patriots Appreciation Weekend, encouraging residents to observe the Super Bowl.

title: Woman convicted of fraud after living under a stolen identity for more than 20 years
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Lina Maria Orovio-Hernandez convicted in Boston for identity theft, voter fraud, and stealing $400,000 in benefits.
Orovio-Hernandez used a stolen identity for 20 years to acquire state IDs, a U.S. passport, and vote fraudulently.
She faces sentences ranging from five to 10 years in prison and possibly deportation after serving her sentence.

title: Celtics rally from 22 down in Vucevic’s debut to beat Heat: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 11 points and grabbed 12 rebounds in his debut for the Celtics, who beat the Heat 98-96.
The Celtics rallied from a 21-point halftime deficit with key contributions from Payton Pritchard and Derrick White.
Coach Joe Mazzulla acknowledged over-preparation and lineup decisions, but praised the team’s second-half adjustments.

title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially declared neutrality in Super Bowl LX, saying he doesn't have a preference between Patriots and Seahawks.
Brady later expressed support for Patriots owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, encouraging them to win a seventh Super Bowl.
Brady's comments received backlash from former teammate Vince Wilfork and current Patriots player Robert Spillane for not fully supporting the team.
